Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; exterior, white slip: painted decoration consisting of goose (part of body, wing and neck remaining) to right; part of pendant roundel, rosettes and elaborate floral motif as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941. For parallels regarding the decoration, see Dublin UCD 309 which Lemos places in the Würzburg Chalice Group and more specifically, argues was decorated by the Painter of the Würzburg Chalices. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices, see Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0013) (phase 2)
